snippet: The debate comes as the refugee crisis in Europe and Russia’s military intervention in Syria have increased pressure on President Obama to take more forceful action.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and PETER BAKER

abstract: Obama administration is embroiled in debate over whether to protect civilians trapped in Syria's civil war by using American military forces to set up no-fly zones and safe havens; fact that officials are once again looking at option of no-fly zones underscores increasing urgency of crisis as flow of refugees grows and Russian airstrikes heighten conflict.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The debate comes as the refugee crisis in Europe and Russia’s military intervention in Syria have increased pressure on President Obama to take more forceful action.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Debating Ways to Shield Syrian Civilians
headline.main: U.S. Is Debating Ways to Shield Syrian Civilians
